He also leads Neo4j's Data Journalism Accelerator Program. Prior to Neo4j, he worked as a software engineer for a variety of startups. William holds a masters degree in Computer Science from the University of Montana. You can find him online at lyonwj.com or @lyonwj

previousSpeakers.bio: I combine my 13 years of professional software engineering experience with a passion for leadership and communication skills. Originally from the UK but now based in Australia, I have consulted, performed workshops and developed software for clients across the UK, Australia, New Zealand and the United States. Technology in all its forms is part of my makeup and so I code, speak, write, teach, make, game and listen to all things geek

I also have a nick for writing tiny javascript modules on npm to help a few developers out there so they need not rewrite same utilities that we all might need (usually it‚Äôs the case that we‚Äôre only a handful needing those so there‚Äôs really nothing too worry much about).

previousSpeakers.bio: James Simpson has spent the greater part of his life pushing the web forward by challenging what is possible in a browser. He is also passionate about open-source as the author of many projects, including the popular howler.js audio library.

previousSpeakers.bio:
Alfredo is a Director of Engineering at Hearst working with technical and non-technical teams to develop tools that abstract best practices and performance enhancements into measurable business goals.

His current interests include creating highly performant and flexible web applications that enable developers to be productive.

Prior to Hearst, Alfredo worked for an ad platform writing low-level JavaScript that catered to strict browser support requirements. Outside of the web, Alfredo is a musician, film enthusiast, and comedy fan.

I was a Code for Philly Open Source Mentorship Program fellow and co-created the Interactive Mechanics Mentorship Program for Diversity and Inclusion in Tech.'

previousSpeakers.bio: Viral Parmar is a Serial entrepreneur who runs ComExpo Cyber security company as well as Infinite Defense Foundation a non-profit organization in India. He is a Developer Advocate, Productivity Hacker, Open Source Strategist, Technical Evangelist, Community Liaison, International TechSpeaker, he is a Cyber Security researcher by profession and open source enthusiast working in a field of information security from last three years with the expertise in Cyber Crime Investigation, Public Key Infrastructure, Social Engineering, Web App Penetration Testing, Digital Forensics and Mobile Security. He found sever vulnerability in 150+ well known websites like Intel, your story and solved more than 100 cases of cyber-crime & online frauds. He is famous for his research Cyber Disorder and Who is spying on you. Trained 150,000+ people till now and aware them about privacy and security. Given Seminars and workshops in 150+ Organizations. He is Working with Mozilla foundation from last 2 years as Reps, Mentor in Mozilla Open Leadership Project, Coach(Privacy and Security) in MozSprint 2018, also working with L10N project on Pontoon, Rust and WebVR projects.
previousSpeakers.name: Viral Parmar
previousSpeakers.title: Cyber Security Researcher

previousSpeakers.bio:
Emily graduated from Stevens Institute of Technology in 2015 with her Bachelor‚Äôs and Master‚Äôs of Science in Computer Science, as well as a Bachelor‚Äôs of Arts in Visual Arts and Technology. After graduating, she entered the CORE Technology rotational program at Comcast NBCUniversal, where she worked on three different teams across the organization over the course of two years.'
'After completing the program, she joined Comcast‚Äôs Experience Design department as a UX Engineer, where she has been for the last two years. The prototypes Emily and her team develop help to guide production teams on building out final products, allow senior leaders to demo new ideas to executives, and for researchers to conduct user testing sessions will real life customers.'
'While her team specializing in build JavaScript web applications, Emily also has a passion for animation, is a Captain in the Air Force Reserve, and is an amateur aerial circus artist. One day, she might just run away and join the circus.

previousSpeakers.bio:
Angel started his career as an US Air Force Space Systems Operations specialist in Cape Canaveral AF Station where he realized his passion for technology and software development. He has extensive experience in the private, public and military sectors and his technical experience includes military/space lift operations, technical writing, software development, SRE/DevOPs engineering. He also has a wealth of experience in defense and federal sectors such as contracting, information systems security and management.

You can usually find him speaking at or organizing local tech meetups and hackathons where he enjoys engaging with developers.

Angel‚Äôs passions are positive disruption, learning, teaching, mentoring but most of all inspiring all forms of technologists & building awesome tech communities.
previousSpeakers.name: Angel Rivera

previousSpeakers.bio:
Born in Chicago, raised in Dayton, I am a midwest boy. With both parents in education, learning was something I was raised to love. Moving to Dayton, I was fortunate enough to come across opportunities I may not have had. One of these opportunities was a position at the University of Dayton Research Institute (UDRI) as a junior developer. I was working at UDRI through college, which ended with my Associates in Applied Sciences at Sinclair College. I currently work as a Web Developer at Crown Equipment.

I am a problem solver. Developing software is one of my outlets for problem-solving. Mainly developing web applications, my preferred language is JavaScript (mainly Angular and Node). I am currently developing an app to help solve the reading problem. The other outlet is entrepreneurship, in which I have launched BluPrint (discoverbluprint.com (shameless plug)), to help solve the issues that young artists are facing today.

Technology is amazing. The capabilities it can bring are immense, and I want to be a part of bringing it to everyone. There are others like myself, who come from marginalized communities, that have a locked door, preventing them from raising themselves up. Tech is the key to that lock.
previousSpeakers.name: Ali Abiba
previousSpeakers.title: Web Developer

previousSpeakers.bio: Fernando Medina Corey currently spends his days making courses to help software engineers, architects, and technology professionals learn the technologies they need to succeed. He has worked with a variety of different technologies in order to develop web applications, manage data pipelines, and architect cloud infrastructure. In addition to his work, he founded and runs the Redmond Python meetup to help folks learn Python. Fernando has also taught and TAed classes on Python, the Command Line, and big data technologies for Python User Groups and Girl Develop It.
previousSpeakers.name: Fernando Medina Corey

previousSpeakers.bio: Richard is the author of ‚ÄúElm in Action‚Äù from Manning Publications, and the instructor for the Frontend Masters Introduction to Elm and Advanced Elm workshops. He is a member of the Elm Core Team and works at NoRedInk, which has over 300,000 lines of Elm code in production, and which has employed Elm creator Evan Czaplicki since 2016. In his free time Richard hosts the Philadelphia Elm Meetup, and maintains open-source Elm libraries such as elm-test and elm-css. Some have said he‚Äôs ‚Äúa fan of Elm,‚Äù but he‚Äôs not sure where they got that wild idea.
previousSpeakers.name: Richard Feldman
